org.freezedry.persistence

Class AbstractPersistence

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.freezedry.persistence.AbstractPersistence
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Persistence
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractFileBasedPersistence

    public abstract class AbstractPersistence
extends java.lang.Object
implements Persistence
    Abstract class implementing the Persistence interface, and managing the PersistenceEngine.

    Implementing subclasses must implement two methods:

        getPersistenceReader()
        getPersistenceWriter()
    For example, the XmlPersistence class will return XmlReader and XmlWriter objects, respectively. And the JsonPersistence class will return JsonReader and JsonWriter objects, respectively.

        public PersistenceEngine getPersistenceEngine()
        Specified by:
        getPersistenceEngine in interface Persistence
        Returns:
        The PersistenceEngine that is used to convert an object to a semantic mode and convert a semantic model into an object.

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.Object object,
         java.io.Writer writer)
        Description copied from interface: Persistence
        Writes the specified object's persisted form to the specified Writer. The subclass implementations determine the objects persisted form. For example, they could be XML, JSON, lists of key-value pairs, or some other implementation.
        Specified by:
        write in interface Persistence
        Parameters:
        object - The object to convert to its persisted form and written to the specified Writer.
        writer - The Writer used to which to write the persisted form.
